title: Quality of life measure for children with Epilepsy: A psychometric evaluation of the Italian version.
abstract: To report on the Italian validation of the Child Epilepsy Quality of Life Questionnaire (CHEQOL-25), including both the child self-report and parent-proxy versions. The validation procedure was conducted at a single Italian centre between July 2024 and July 2025, involving 252 children with epilepsy and their parents. A forward-backward translation process was carried out in line with established best-practice guidelines. Data collection included family interviews and medical chart reviews. Psychometric evaluation covered reliability and validity. All items exceeded the accepted thresholds (â‰¥ 0.78) for both content validity and comprehensibility. The factor structure closely replicated the original five-factor model, with certain items showing stronger loadings than the original study within the Interpersonal/Social and Intrapersonal/Emotional domains in both related versions.
